content: Is there any way to run multiple UI tests at once using x.py? I usually use x.py test src/test/ui/<some-test-name>.rs, but at least in the past, that only worked for one at a time.
Would using --test-args multiple times with the test name do the trick?

If that's not possible, I guess I'll use this monster of a command :laughing::

$ x test --bless src/test/ui/destructuring-assignment/tuple_struct_destructure_fail.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/error-codes/E0023.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/issues/issue-72574-2.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/match/match-pattern-field-mismatch.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/pattern/issue-67037-pat-tup-scrut-ty-diff-less-fields.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/pattern/issue-74539.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/pattern/pat-tuple-overfield.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/pattern/pat-tuple-underfield.rs && x test --bless src/test/ui/pattern/pattern-error-continue.rs

Space-separating the test names seems to work for me

./x.py test src/test/ui/error-codes/E0023.rs src/test/ui/error-codes/E0025.rs

Is that not working for you?
Huh, maybe it's been fixed since I last tried then. I'll try that!
